summary: The Sustainable Aviation Fuel Act aims to promote the development and use of sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from aviation. The bill sets national goals for emissions reductions, defines key terms, authorizes funding for SAF projects and research, establishes a low-carbon aviation fuel standard under the Clean Air Act, mandates SAF procurement by the Department of Defense, and extends tax credits for SAF production.  It also directs research by the FAA and Department of Energy.
